If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to 30 mm long; chestnut-brown elytra; exposed dorsum warty; ventrum with minute papillae. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Oblong, up to 25 mm long; pale dorsum with dark pigment medially between elytra. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Oblong, up to 15 mm long. The prostomium Longer than broad; first pair of eyes lateral and positioned well back. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large and stout, up to ~40 mm long. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~20 mm long; blue-grey. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~20 mm long; mauve, each elytron with a central white spot. The neurosetae Stout, with short spinulose blades; tips clearly bidentate. The antennae and cirri Smooth with slight subterminal swellings. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Tough, rusty brown; up to ~40 mm long; head and first elytra often paler than the rest; mid-dorsum not fully covered by elytra. The prostomium Longer than broad; first pair of eyes well back; second pair often hidden beneath the occipital fold; median antenna slightly longer than prostomium; lateral antennae slightly shorter. The neurosetae With ~7 rows of spinules and strong curved unidentate tips; no true secondary tooth, though the last spinule may mimic one. The antennae and cirri Smooth with a subterminal swelling and dark band before the filiform tip. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Tough, grey, up to ~30 mm long; elytra reddish brown. The prostomium Longer than broad; first pair of eyes positioned halfway back; median antenna ~2 times prostomial length; lateral antennae ~1.5 times prostomial length. The elytra Oval with smooth margins; surface densely covered with large spherical tubercles of varying size largest sculptured like  to golf balls, to  smaller tubercles with minutely scaly surfaces. The antennae and cirri Smooth with a dark band at the subterminal swelling. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Oblong, ~25 mm long; 15 pairs of elytra covering all but the last 4 to 6 segments. The prostomium All three antennae terminal in origin (as in Lepidonotus); lateral antennae smooth, ~â prostomial length; median antenna unknown; anterior eyes lateral and positioned about halfway back. The antennae and cirri Dorsal cirri smooth, slightly swollen distally, shorter than the neurosetae. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate, tapered, up to ~45 mm long with ~78 segments; 16 pairs of elytra covering only the anterior half; posterior segments cirrigerous with three longitudinal rows of fleshy dorsal tubercles. The prostomium Longer than broad; lateral ceratophores with basal constrictions; median antenna smooth with a slight subterminal swelling, ~2 times  prostomial length; lateral antennae shorter; palps short and stout. The antennae and cirri Antennae smooth with faint subterminal swellings. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~35 mm long with ~55 segments; 20 to 24 pairs of pale mottled grey elytra extending nearly to the posterior end. The prostomium Rectangular; both eye pairs posterior and close together; all three antennae terminal; median antenna slightly longer than prostomium, lateral antennae ~â prostomial length. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Very long, up to ~100 mm with ~150 segments; dorsum marked by regular brown cross-bars. The prostomium Rectangular, partly overlapped by a large occipital fold with a papillose margin; first eyes well back and lateral; antennae slender with faint subterminal swellings  to  median ~2 times prostomial length, laterals slightly shorter; palps very long. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body ~25 mm long with ~65 segments; body irregularly banded brown. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate and flattened, up to ~70 mm with ~100 segments; segments marked by purple transverse bars; elytra speckled and bearing a white spot over the elytrophore. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate, flattened, up to ~70 mm with ~100 segments; purple transverse bars on most segments except alternate cirrigerous ones; elytra each with a central dark spot. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate, up to ~130 mm with >100 segments. The glands Spinning gland from segment 89 onward; no branchial vesicles. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large tubicolous species; up to ~300 mm; stout anteriorly, flattened posteriorly. The parapodia Notopodia as anterodorsal folds; neuropodia very stout. The cirri  first segments First segment forms a small occipital fold; first parapodium elongated, forward-directed, with tentacular cirri and fine setae. The antennae  palps Median antenna tapered, ~prostomial length; laterals slightly shorter and often hidden; palps long and banded. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~120 mm long. The prostomium Small; median antenna long and projecting forward beyond the eye-stalks; lateral antennae thicker than the median, each with a brown spot. The elytra Smooth; first pairs cover the head but do not cover most of the posterior dorsum. The notosetae Slender, minutely spinulose. The neurosetae Three groups Superior Unknown, Middle (aristate setae) Stout acicular setae with flattened spear-like tips bearing a cluster of spinules, Inferior Serrated setae with hairy tips, the hairs arising from a basal group of long spinules. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Very large, up to ~300 mm long; anterior region tough and cylindrical, posterior region softer and flattened. The prostomium Anterior margin notched between rounded palps; antennae short, scarcely extending beyond palps and often wrinkled in preservation; tentacular cirri smooth. The notosetae Absent (no acicular or comb setae). The neurosetae Superior simple, narrow-winged capillaries with pilose blades; inferior compound bidentate falcigers with short blades. The acicula Slightly bent with blunt tips. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate, rounded anteriorly; up to ~120 mm long. The prostomium Anterior margin deeply bilobed; antennae subequal, about 1 to 5 times prostomial length. The setae Acicular setae yellow, with two small blunt teeth and small guards; compound setae falcigerous with small bidentate blades; comb setae present. The peristomium Long; bears a pair of very small tentacular cirri. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body 70 to 90 mm long; red when alive, dark brown in alcohol. The prostomium Anterior margin deeply notched between the palps. The setae Acicular setae from ~setiger 40, black, simple, very blunt, without guards; compound falcigers with short triangular blades, weakly bidentate, without visible guards. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Rounded anteriorly, somewhat flattened posteriorly; fresh specimens with a median row of pale spots. The setae Compound falcigers with bidentate blades; two yellow acicular setae with tridentate tips and guards (apical tooth small and may break, giving a bidentate appearance). If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body 50 to 70 mm long; reddish brown; pale bars on the tentacular segment and fifth setiger; posterior segments with white median spots. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body About 50 mm long; anterior segments with red-brown transverse bars that fade in alcohol. The antennae and tentacular cirri Antennae long (â1.5 times prostomial breadth), weakly annulated distally; tentacular cirri and first 5 to 6 dorsal cirri very long and tapered. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body About 50 mm long. The prostomium Small; palps largely fused, anterior margin only faintly notched. The setae Compound falcigers bidentate with long pointed, striated guards; acicular setae yellow, strongly tridentate with distinct guards, up to four per parapodium in posterior feet. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Very large, elongate; up to ~400 mm long; anterior region rounded, posterior region flattened; lives permanently in a tough, branching, parchment-like tube with multiple openings. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large, 100 to 200 mm long; inhabits a parchment-like tube with older tube openings visible as closed scars along the sides. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~150 mm long (South African specimens usually â¤50 mm). The prostomium Anterior margin notched between the palps. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Copper-red; about 120 mm long. The prostomium Anterior margin shallowly notched between the palps. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Very large; up to ~560 mm long and ~20 mm wide; brownish-purple; head and peristome white with a distinct white band on setiger 4. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large; ~100 to 250 mm long; reddish brown, often with a distinct white bar on setiger 4. The setae Acicular setae black, bidentate with small guards; compound setae falcigerous, bidentate with two well-developed teeth and rounded guards. The cirri Dorsal cirri jointed. The branchiae Begin on setiger 3; increase to >10 filaments (shorter than dorsal cirri); decrease posteriorly. The acicula Black. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large; up to ~350 mm long and ~15 mm wide; reddish brown, often with a white collar on setiger 4. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large; ~150 to 230 mm long. The prostomium Anterior margin notched between the palps. The cirri Anterior dorsal cirri longer than the branchiae. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large, elongate; up to ~350 mm; flattened posterior to the anterior segments. The prostomium Anterior margin deeply bilobed. The acicula Three per parapodium anteriorly, reduced to two posteriorly; shafts dark brown to black with pale tips. The acicular setae Pale distally, bluntly bidentate, with small guards. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Stout, oval in section; up to ~250 mm long. The prostomium Anterior margin bilobed. The setae Superior setae include winged capillaries and numerous comb-setae with coarse teeth; inferior setae compound, spinigerous. The cirri Dorsal cirri about as long as the setigerous lobes. The antennae Smooth; nearly twice the prostomial length. The branchiae Begin on setiger ~16 to 30; up to 4 to 7 filaments; decreasing posteriorly. The acicula Two to three, black, blunt-tipped. The acicular setae Pale, bidentate with small guards in adults; guards larger in juveniles. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender, rounded to slightly flattened; over ~200 mm long. The prostomium Palps partially fused; anterior margin not distinctly bilobed; eyes indistinct. The setae Superior setae winged capillaries and comb-setae; inferior setae compound with knife-shaped blades, often deeply retracted and appearing simple. The antennae Smooth; about equal to prostomial length. The branchiae Appear on setiger ~20 to 50 (size-dependent); up to 6 filaments; decreasing posteriorly. The jaws Mandibles normal; maxillary formula Mx I 1+1, Mx II 7+7, Mx III 7+0, Mx IV 3+8, Mx V reduced to chitinised areas without teeth. The acicula Brown with pale tips; blunt; three anteriorly, reducing to one mid-body. The acicular setae Single brown seta with a simple blunt tip. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body About ~80 mm long. The prostomium Palps completely fused; anterior margin rounded. The setae Superior setae winged capillaries and comb-setae; inferior setae falcigerous, bidentate with divergent teeth and rounded guards. The cirri Dorsal cirri short and conical anteriorly; bifurcate in branchial region (diagnostic character). The antennae Short, smooth; about half the prostomial length. The branchiae From setiger ~22 to posterior end; up to 4 to 5 filaments; filaments arise directly from dorsum (no axial stem). The acicula Three brown acicula with pale blunt tips anteriorly, reduced to one posteriorly. The acicular setae Brown, yellowish distally; minutely bidentate; lacking guards. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body ~60 mm long; oval in cross-section; prostomium with a brown bar; anterior body with reddish-brown pattern. The prostomium Bilobed anterior margin. The setae Ventral setae compound, falcigerous, with two large teeth. The cirri Dorsal cirri equal to setigerous lobe prebranchially; equal to branchial filaments in branchial region; much longer than setigerous lobe post-branchially. The antennae Short, smooth; about equal to prostomial length. The branchiae Begin on setiger 8 with four filaments; increase to ~18 filaments by setiger 18; decrease and end around setiger 28. The jaws Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 5+5; Mx III = 5+0; Mx IV = 3+8. The acicula Yellow, blunt. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender, rounded in cross-section; up to ~70 mm long with ~200 segments; no colour markings. The prostomium Anterior margin smoothly rounded. The setae Superior setae narrow-winged capillaries and comb-setae with 5 to 10 teeth; inferior setae compound falcigers with long, narrow bidentate blades. The antennae Tapered, not annulated; median antenna slightly longer than prostomium. The branchiae Appear abruptly around setigers 15 to 19; end ~20 segments later; each branchia large, pectinate, with 8 to 10 long filaments arising from a short dorsal cirrus. The jaws Weakly chitinised; maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 7+8; Mx III = 7+0; Mx IV = 7+11; Mx V = chitinous plates without teeth. The acicula Pale, blunt; three anteriorly, reduced to one over most of body. The acicular setae Single pale seta from setigers ~35 to 40 onwards; bidentate with small terminal tooth and guards. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender, rounded in cross-section; ~30 mm long. The prostomium Anterior margin bilobed. The setae Superior setae winged capillaries and comb-setae with 8 to 15 teeth; inferior setae compound falcigers with two strong teeth. The cirri Dorsal cirri well developed anteriorly, smaller than branchiae posteriorly. The antennae Smooth to weakly wrinkled; slightly longer than prostomium. The branchiae Simple filaments restricted to posterior segments; appear after setiger ~55 (juveniles) and best developed on last few segments (adults). The jaws Pale; maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 4+4; Mx III = 6+0; Mx IV = 5+10. The acicula Blunt; pale in juveniles, black in adults; appear from ~setiger 30. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~150 mm long, ~10 mm wide; roughly oval in cross-section; brown with slightly darker peristome. The prostomium Anterior margin bilobed. The setae Superior setae winged capillaries and comb-setae; inferior setae falcigerous with rounded guards. The antennae Smooth; extend back to the first setiger. The branchiae Begin on setiger 12 to 30 (size-dependent); extend almost to posterior end; up to four filaments. The jaws Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 3+4; Mx III = 4+0; Mx IV = 3+6; Mx V = 1+1. The acicula Black, bluntly pointed. The acicular setae Black, unidentate, without guards. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Very long, up to ~300 mm; anterior region rounded, posterior region flattened. The prostomium Anterior margin bilobed. The setae Superior comb-setae with 20 to 25 teeth; inferior setae compound and falcigerous. The antennae Smooth; about 1.5 times prostomial length. The branchiae Begin on setiger 20 to 50 (size-dependent); up to six filaments at maximum; continue to posterior end with reduced filaments. The acicula Dark with pale, blunt tips. The acicular setae Pale, bidentate, with small guards. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~100 mm long and ~5 mm wide; brown with minute white spots. The prostomium Anterior margin white and bilobed; pair of reniform black eyes just external to lateral antennae. The setae Superior limbate capillaries and comb-setae; inferior setae compound with short falcigerous blades. The parapodia Dorsal cirrus conical; setigerous lobe truncate; ventral cirrus rounded anteriorly, posteriorly merging with glandular ventral pad. The antennae White, slightly tapered, about equal to prostomial length. The jaws Mandibles heavy, gouge-shaped, strongly calcified; maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1, Mx II = 3+3 (teeth very robust), Mx III = (2 to 3)+0, Mx IV = 2+(4 to 8), Mx V = 1+1. The acicula Black with blunt tips. The acicular setae Appear from ~setiger 20; brown, bidentate, with small guards. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~75 mm long. The prostomium Anterior margin bilobed; eyes reniform. The setae Superior limbate capillaries and comb-setae; inferior setae bidentate falcigers. The parapodia Short conical dorsal cirrus set high above the broad setigerous lobe; ventral cirrus papilliform, becoming indistinct from the glandular ventral pad after ~setiger 30. The antennae Tapered, slightly longer than the prostomium. The jaws Mandibles gouge-shaped, partly calcified; maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1, Mx II = (4 to 5)+4, Mx III = (3 to 5)+0, Mx IV = 2+5, Mx V reduced to chitinised areas. The acicula Brown shafts with blunt ends. The acicular setae Appear from ~setiger 20; brown, with blunt, minutely bilobed tips. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~150 mm long; reddish with white punctuations and white transverse bars on setigers 2 and 5. The prostomium Anterior margin bilobed; eyes large, black, and oval. The setae Superior limbate capillaries and comb-setae; inferior compound falcigers with bidentate blades. The parapodia Dorsal cirri digitiform, as long as the compressed, truncate setigerous lobes; ventral cirri papilliform with swollen bases. The antennae Subequal, shorter than the prostomium. The jaws Mandibles heavy and gouge-shaped; maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1, Mx II = 4+4, Mx III = 4+0, Mx IV = 4+4, Mx V reduced to chitinised patches. The acicula Dark. The acicular setae Appear from ~setiger 20; bidentate with guards. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender, up to ~60 mm long; enclosed in an erect, tough, translucent tube that may be annulated or spirally twisted but is always attached. The prostomium With subulate frontal antennae and five smooth occipital antennae of normal length; antennae borne on ceratophores with 5 to 7 rings; inner lateral ceratophores sometimes bearing short stumpy projections. The setae Pseudocompound setae on setigers 1 to 4 strongly bidentate with well-developed hoods; comb setae with ~12 teeth from setiger 6; two bidentate acicular setae appear a few segments later. The parapodia Setigers 1 to 3 with subulate dorsal cirri, low presetal lips, postsetal lobes with an inferior papilla, and subulate ventral cirri; in posterior segments ventral cirri become glandular pads and postsetal lobes are reduced to papillae. The branchiae Poorly developed; 2 to 5 pairs present on setigers 4 to 9. The jaws Pale and weakly chitinised; maxillary formula Mx I = 1 + 1; Mx II = 8 + 7; Mx III = 7 + 0; Mx IV = 6 + 10. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender, up to ~30 mm long; anterior region brownish with a dark spot behind each parapodium, paired spots connected by a dorsal cross-bar; tube encrusted with debris, coarse sand, or mud. The prostomium With distinct eyes; frontal antennae subulate; occipital antennae fairly long, borne on ceratophores with 6 to 7 rings, sometimes with short lateral projections. The setae Anterior setigers (1 to 3/4) with capillaries and pseudocompound hooks that are bidentate and hooded; posterior setigers lack hooks, with capillaries developing broader wings, and comb-setae plus bidentate acicular setae appearing. The parapodia First three setigers each with cirriform dorsal and ventral cirri and a tapered postsetal lobe; later parapodia simpler. The branchiae Begin on setiger 5 and extend to setiger 20 to 30; anterior branchiae well developed with spirally arranged filaments, posterior ones progressively reduced to 1 to 2 filaments. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small, ~35 mm long; tube fragile, of mud with large projecting shell fragments; pigmentation variable, anterior segments often brown, ventral cirri white with a mid-ventral pale streak. The prostomium Frontal antennae reduced to flattened expansions of the prostomium; occipital antennae on short, ringed ceratophores with lateral lobes on five rings. The setae Anterior pseudocompound setae hooded and strongly bidentate; winged capillaries with serrated blades present; bidentate acicular setae from setiger 10; comb-setae with 18 to 20 teeth from setiger 15. The branchiae Begin on setiger 5; weakly developed with 2 to 3 whorls of filaments; disappear by about setiger 30. The jaws Poorly developed; mandibles with straight, tapered shafts. The ontogeny Juveniles lack tentacular cirri until relatively late development. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large, 100 to 150 mm long; tube sausage-like, of hardened mud without shell fragments; anterior region brown with a darker spot behind the median occipital antenna and dark transverse bars on anterior branchiferous segments. The prostomium Frontal antennae subulate; median occipital antenna borne on a ceratophore with 6 to 8 rings. The setae Anterior pseudocompound setae hooded and strongly bidentate; comb-setae appear on setigers 6 to 8 with 15 to 25 teeth; bidentate acicular setae appear around setiger 16. The branchiae Begin on setiger 5; filaments fairly long and well developed. The jaws Mandibles dark, thickened, often sausage-shaped in adults. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Medium-sized, up to ~50 mm long; anterior region brown, without distinct colour pattern; tube with projecting shell fragments. The prostomium Frontal antennae subulate; median occipital antenna borne on a ceratophore with ~10 smooth rings. The setae Anterior pseudocompound setae hooded and strongly bidentate; comb-setae with 15 to 25 teeth, blades broad and rolled into a funnel-like form giving the appearance of a single broad central tooth. The branchiae Well developed, with fairly long filaments. The jaws Mandibles with straight, tapered shafts. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Medium-sized, ~40 to 60 mm long; anterior segments rounded, posterior segments dorsally flattened; anterior region with brown transverse bars; tube reinforced with mud. The prostomium With a pair of minute anterior eyes; occipital antennae long, borne on short ceratophores with ~6 rings. The setae Anterior pseudocompound hooks hooded and tridentate; posterior feet with winged capillaries, comb-setae, and bidentate acicular setae with guards. The branchiae Begin on setiger 6 to 9; increase to a maximum of four filaments; reduced to a single filament after setiger ~40. The jaws Maxillary formula Mx I = 1 + 1; Mx II = 7 + 8; Mx III = 8 + 0; Mx IV = (4 to 6) + (7 to 8). The acicula Yellow. The antennae  cirri Tentacular cirri inserted behind inner lateral antennae, shorter than the peristomial segment; ventral cirri subulate on setigers 1 to 3. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body 40 to 150 mm long; body elongate; lives in a characteristically free, flattened tube densely covered with large shell fragments. The prostomium Cordate with a central brown spot; one anterior pair of minute eye spots and a large pair of eyes external to the inner lateral antennae. The setae Anterior setigers (1 to 3 or 1 to 4) with stout pseudocompound or simple hooks, bidentate and usually guarded; from setiger 4 onward smooth-winged capillaries and fine comb-setae with ~10 to 12 teeth; long stout bidentate acicular setae appear around setigers 10 to 15. The branchiae Single branchial filament present from setiger 9 to 13, depending on size. The jaws Mandibles with a weak tooth on the calcareous cutting edge and straight diverging shafts; maxillary formula Mx I = 1 + 1; Mx II = 6 + (6 to 7); Mx III = 8 + 0; Mx IV = (6 to 8) + (8 to 10); Mx V = 0 + 0 (dark, toothless plates). The antennae  ceratophores Ceratophores short with 3 to 4 rings; ceratostyles long, tapered, reaching to about setiger 6. The cirri  parapodia Tentacular segment short but tentacular cirri long, reaching the anterior margin of the prostomium; setigers 1 to 3 greatly enlarged and projecting forward; presetal lamella dorsal and heart-shaped on anterior feet; postsetal lobe elongate and cirriform on setigers 2 to 15, reduced posteriorly; ventral cirri tapered on first 2 to 3 feet, then swollen and cushion-like; dorsal cirri elongate anteriorly, reduced posteriorly. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large, elongate; ~100 to 350 mm long. The prostomium Rounded; two pairs of eyes, outer pair larger. The setae Fine tapered capillaries present throughout; posterior feet with two yellow acicular setae, bidentate. The parapodia Uniform throughout; dorsal cirrus flattened and strap-like, constricted at base; presetal lobe short and rounded; postsetal lobe longer. The antennae Three stout antennae, much shorter than the prostomium and often hidden by a biannulate peristomial fold. The jaws Mandibles well chitinised; maxillae with long slender supports and a faint dagger-shaped median piece; jaws often asymmetrical with the first tooth much larger than the rest; maxillary formula Mx I = 12 (or 7+5) + 7; Mx II = 9 + 15; Mx III = 6 + 5; Mx IV = 6 + 6; Mx V = 1 + 1. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender, cylindrical; up to ~135 mm long and ~3 mm wide with ~110 segments; lumbrinerid-like in appearance. The prostomium Ovoid to rounded; eyes absent; three small antennae recessed in a peristomial pocket. The setae Winged capillaries and compound hooks anteriorly; capillaries with very narrow blades and hooks becoming simple in middle and posterior feet; acicula absent. The parapodia Anterior feet with low presetal lobe and large ear-shaped postsetal lobe; posterior feet with subequal lobes, postsetal lobe bearing a superior point. The jaws Mandibles well developed with short divergent shafts; maxillae of four symmetrical toothed plates with small supports; maxillary formula Mx I = 1 + 1; Mx II = 3 + 3; Mx III = 2 + 2; Mx IV = 1 + 1 (rectangular, toothless plates). The peristomium Peristomium and following segment apodous and achaetous; paired buccal cushions present anterior to mouth. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender; up to ~100 mm long. The prostomium Conical. The setae Anterior feet with long winged capillaries and short-bladed compound hooks (from setigers 1 to 4 to ~12 to 15); posterior feet with simple hooks only. The parapodia Presetal lobe low and rounded throughout; postsetal lobe conical and compressed anteriorly, becoming shorter posteriorly and nearly equal to the presetal lobe. The jaws Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 4+4; Mx III = curved cutting plate without a distinct tooth; Mx IV = 1+1; maxillary supports short and broad. The acicula Yellow. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender; ~20 mm long with ~120 segments; pale yellow. The prostomium Bluntly conical. The setae Anterior feet with ~2 long-bladed compound hooks and 3 to 4 winged capillaries; capillaries disappear before mid-body; hooks become simple after ~10 to 15 segments and persist as 2 to 3 simple hooks to posterior end. The parapodia Anterior feet bilobed with presetal lobe initially smaller but soon equal to postsetal lobe; this condition persists over most of body; mid-body feet reduced; posterior feet with both lobes long and filamentous, presetal lobe slightly longer. The acicula Yellow. The jaws  maxillae Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 3+3 (teeth stout, almost bilobed); Mx III = cutting plates without distinct teeth; Mx IV = 1+1 (large, rounded); mandibles poorly calcified with united shafts; maxillary supports broad and triangular. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate; up to ~100 mm; anterior segments swollen in juveniles to accommodate large jaws. The prostomium Conical with a conspicuous nuchal slit at the prostomial to peristomial junction. The setae Winged capillaries from setiger 1 to 50; long compound hooks from setiger 1 to 30; simple hooks plus capillaries from setiger 31 to 50; only simple hooks posteriorly. The parapodia Anterior feet with low presetal and rounded postsetal lobes; middle feet with subequal lobes directed obliquely upward; posterior feet elongate and bilabiate with stout lobes. The acicula Yellow; four per parapodium. The jaws  maxillae Mandibles heavily calcified with widely divergent shafts; maxillae robust with characteristic large white plates on Mx IV bordered in black; maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = (2 to 3)+(2 to 3); Mx III = 2+2; Mx IV = indistinct paired plates; maxillary supports long and triangular. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender; ~50 to 70 mm long. The prostomium Conical. The setae Slender capillaries present to mid-body; long-bladed simple hooks appear within first ~10 setigers and persist posteriorly, with blades shortening toward the rear. The parapodia Anterior feet small with rudimentary presetal lobe and deep, compressed postsetal lobe; presetal lobe enlarges posteriorly while postsetal lobe reduces; posterior feet with elongated base and subequal lobes. The acicula Pale throughout (black reported in some Chatham Island material). The jaws  maxillae Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 5+5; Mx III = indistinct paired cutting plates; Mx IV = 1+1. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small; ~20 mm long; body short and orange. The prostomium Spherical, conspicuously white. The setae Winged capillaries present in first ~30 to 40 feet; hooded compound (or incompletely compound) hooks appear in first 3 to 4 feet, becoming simple posteriorly and persisting to the end. The parapodia Anterior feet with low rounded presetal lobe and a longer but similar postsetal lobe; setae always exceed postsetal lobe length. The acicula Yellow. The jaws  maxillae Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 4 to 5 + 4 to 5; Mx III = 3 to 4 + 3 to 4; Mx IV = 2+2; maxillary supports long. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small; ~40 mm long; orange when alive, pale in alcohol. The prostomium Globular. The setae Winged capillaries present on first ~30 to 40 feet; compound hooks from first to ~20th foot, becoming simple posteriorly with opaque white heads. The parapodia Anterior feet with low rounded presetal lobe and longer conical postsetal lobe; posterior feet slightly longer but similar; setae always exceed postsetal lobe. The acicula Yellow. The jaws  maxillae Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 4 to 5 + 4 to 5; Mx III = 2+2; Mx IV = 1+1. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small; ~20 mm long with ~87 segments. The prostomium Ovoid with dark lateral pigmentation. The setae Winged capillaries from first to ~34th foot; long-shafted compound hooks from anterior feet to ~16th foot, replaced posteriorly by simple short-headed hooks. The parapodia Anterior feet with low presetal lobes and long ear-shaped postsetal lobes with an inferior expansion; posterior feet unknown. The acicula Unknown. The jaws  maxillae Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 3+4; Mx III = 1+1 (very small plate); Mx IV = 2+2; maxillary supports long and kite-shaped. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate; up to ~150 mm long. The prostomium Conical. The setae Winged capillaries from first to ~40 to 50th foot; long-bladed compound hooks from ~3rd to ~25th foot, replaced posteriorly by simple hooks with progressively shorter heads. The parapodia Anterior feet with a low rounded presetal lobe and a larger bluntly triangular postsetal lobe; posterior feet with long conical postsetal lobes, always shorter than the setae. The acicula Yellow. The jaws  maxillae Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = (4 to 5)+(4 to 5); Mx III = 2+2; Mx IV = 1+1; maxillary supports fairly long. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Very small; ~10 mm long with ~60 segments. The prostomium Conical, extremely elongated; as long as the peristome plus first four setigers. The setae Winged capillaries present from first setiger, with very short broad blades; simple hooks from setiger 4, bidentate with divergent teeth and a short broad hood. The parapodia First six setigers with minute lobes; later parapodia larger, conical, with rudimentary presetal lobe and a conical postsetal lobe shorter than the setae; posterior parapodia unknown. The acicula Pale. The jaws  maxillae Mandible shafts completely fused; maxillary supports very large; maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = 3+3; Mx III = 1+1 (short plates with indistinct teeth); Mx IV = 0+0 (toothless oval plates). Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large; up to ~250 mm long. The prostomium Conical. The setae Winged capillaries from setiger 1 to ~60; long-headed simple hooks from setiger ~4 to posterior end, hook heads shortening and becoming whitish after ~setiger 30. The parapodia Anterior feet with low rounded presetal lobe and longer bluntly conical postsetal lobe; posterior feet longer but similar in shape. The acicula Yellow. The jaws  maxillae Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = (4 to 5)+(4 to 5); Mx III = 2+2; Mx IV = 1+1; major plates with 4 to 5 teeth; maxillary supports long and kite-shaped. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate; up to ~100 mm or more. The prostomium Conical. The setae Winged capillaries from anterior segments to setiger ~60 to 70; long-bladed simple hooks appear around setiger ~25 to 45 and persist posteriorly, blades shortening after mid-body. The parapodia Anterior feet with low rounded presetal lobe and longer conical postsetal lobe; posterior feet with lengthened postsetal lobe, never exceeding setal length. The acicula Yellow. The jaws  maxillae Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = (4 to 5)+(4 to 5); Mx III = 2+2; Mx IV = 1+1; maxillary supports long and triangular. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate, often exceeding ~120 mm. The prostomium Conical, with dark pigmentation at the base. The setae Anterior setae all winged capillaries (superior long and tapering, inferior short and blunt); long-bladed simple hooks appear around setiger ~40, becoming shorter posteriorly; posterior feet dominated by short-bladed hooks with occasional capillaries. The parapodia Anterior feet with low rounded presetal lobe and compressed postsetal lobe produced dorsally; posterior feet with postsetal lobe very long, digitiform, and greatly exceeding setal length (diagnostic character). The acicula Black. The jaws  maxillae Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = (4 to 5)+(4 to 5); Mx III = 2+2; Mx IV = 1+1; maxillary supports heart-shaped. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate, often exceeding ~100 mm. The prostomium Conical. The setae Anterior setae all winged capillaries; short-headed simple hooks appear around setiger ~40 and fully replace capillaries before mid-body. The parapodia Anterior feet with low rounded presetal lobe and longer conical postsetal lobe; posterior feet with short presetal lobe and very long postsetal lobe that may exceed setal length; adults may develop a ventral papilla between parapodia from mid-body onwards (new diagnostic character). The acicula Yellow. The jaws  maxillae Maxillary formula Mx I = 1+1; Mx II = (4 to 5)+(4 to 5); Mx III = 2+2; Mx IV = 1+1; maxillary supports long and triangular. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate; up to ~190 mm with >300 segments. The prostomium Conical; four eyes present. The setae Winged capillaries with smooth or basally serrated blades; one inferior asymmetrically hooded acicular seta (distinctive character). The parapodia Dorsal cirrus reduced to a slight swelling at parapodial base; presetal lobe low and rounded; postsetal lobe a longer blunt cone. The acicula Two to three; yellow, pointed, tips just piercing the body wall between parapodial lobes. The jaws  maxillae Mandibles black, roughly M-shaped; maxillae well developed with enlarged falcate hooks; maxillary formula Mx I = (1+4)+(1+4); Mx II = (0+12)+(0+12); Mx III = (1+4)+(1+4); Mx IV = (1+3)+(1+3); Mx V = 1+1 (presence of enlarged falcate hook is a diagnostic character). Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Tough, wiry, strongly iridescent; up to ~100 mm; segments short and crowded. The prostomium Bluntly conical; four eyes in a transverse row along posterior margin. The setae Four to five winged capillaries, often basally serrated. The cirri Dorsal cirrus well developed anteriorly as a curved papilla arising from dorsal base of parapodium. The parapodia Presetal lobe low and rounded; postsetal lobe longer, conical. The acicula About three; yellow, pointed, tips just piercing parapodial skin. The jaws  maxillae Mandibles strong, black, roughly H-shaped; maxillae with enlarged first tooth in series; maxillary formula Mx I = (1+9)+(1+8); Mx II = 8+14; Mx III = 7+5; Mx IV = (7+4)+(7+3); Mx V = 1+1. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender, rounded in cross-section; about 100 mm long. The prostomium Depressed, bluntly conical; internal eyes may be present. The setae Not differentiated in original description beyond association with parapodia. The parapodia First two segments achaetous; parapodia well developed thereafter with very small presetal lobe and conical postsetal lobe. The acicula Stout, projecting aciculum present from about setiger 10 to 20; sometimes two per foot. The jaws  maxillae Mandibles stout, black, triangular; maxillae with basal teeth on Mx I and enlarged anterior tooth on all plates; median unpaired support dagger-shaped and entirely black; maxillary formula Mx I = 8+6; Mx II = 8+8; Mx III = 4+3; Mx IV = 1+1; Mx V = 1+1. The posterior end Unknown. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Long, tough, wiry; exceeding 200 mm in length. The prostomium Blunt, depressed, eyeless; almost fused to the first segment. The setae Four to five smooth-winged capillaries between parapodial lobes. The neuropodium Small, truncate setigerous lobe; bears neurosetae and a fusiform ventral cirrus slightly smaller than the dorsal cirrus. The tentacular segment Distinct and comparable in size to setigerous segments; bears two pairs of short tentacular cirri similar to antennae. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Juvenile specimens; small, 3 to 4 mm long with ~36 setigers; body slender; no distinct constricted neck region. The prostomium With three cirriform antennae; two pairs of eyes present; palps massive, bent ventrally, each bearing a slender palpostyle. The setae Notosetae include fine capillaries and a stout recurved hook; neurosetae consist of serrated capillaries only. The cirri Dorsal cirri tapered; ventral cirri tapered but absent on setiger 2. The parapodia Present on all setigers; setigerous lobe blunt; parapodia otherwise simple and weakly developed. The notopodium Typical, well defined; bears an internal aciculum, one to two fine capillary setae, and a stout recurved hook; notopodial hook first appears on setiger 8. The neuropodium Reduced; bears only serrated capillary neurosetae; hooks absent. The pharynx Muscular; jaws absent. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate, colourless; up to ~54 mm long with ~182 segments; segments uniform. The prostomium Broader than long, rounded anteriorly; three slender antennae present, median antenna extending posteriorly to about setiger 5; palps stout with knob-shaped palpostyles. The setae Neuropodial setae capillary only; shorter capillaries finely serrated, longer capillaries smooth; true notosetae absent. The cirri Dorsal cirri Tapered; dorsal cirrus of setiger 1 conspicuously elongate, about twice the length of the tentacular cirri; Ventral cirri Short; presence on setiger 2 uncertain. The parapodia Present from setiger 1; parapodial lobes well developed; anterior parapodia with setae and cirri already present. The notopodium Represented by a tapered dorsal cirrus containing a fine internal aciculum in anterior segments; from approximately setiger 70 onward, the aciculum is replaced by a stout, projecting notopodial hook. The neuropodium Forms an ovoid setigerous lobe; bears only capillary neurosetae. The pharynx Short and stout; mouth opening surrounded by 16 ovoid papillae. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small; ~4 to 5 mm; 16 to 22 setigers. The prostomium Square; four eyes; anterior pair slightly larger and more widely spaced; median antenna fusiform, about prostomial length; lateral antennae similar, longer; palps elongate with short palpophores. The setae Notosetae single capillary; neurosetae falcigerous with long, finely bidentate blades. The cirri Dorsal cirri fusiform, weakly ringed; ventral cirri slender. The parapodia Biramous, weakly developed. The notopodium Reduced; aciculum, single capillary seta, vaguely ringed dorsal cirrus. The neuropodium Triangular presetal lobe; rounded postsetal lip. The proboscis Without papillae or jaws. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small, <10 mm; rather broad; 26 to 35 setigers; greenish-yellow with transverse stripes, fading in alcohol. The prostomium Almost square; four eyes; two long antennae; palps biarticulate. The setae Falcigerous; blades variable in length; terminal hook with very fine secondary tooth below. The cirri Dorsal cirri long, faintly annulated. The parapodia Uniramous. The notopodium Reduced to dorsal cirrus; aciculum present in cirrophore. The neuropodium Triangular presetal lip; low, rounded postsetal lamella. The proboscis Armed; median ventral stylet; paired lateral jaws with serrated cutting edges; margin with 10 to 15 papillae. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Greyish; ~12 mm long. The prostomium Antennae unknown; four eyes; palps slightly tapered with articulation at distal third. The setae Neurosetae variable in length; median setae longest with hair-like tips; inferior setae with minutely bidentate blades. The cirri Dorsal cirrus long; ventral cirrus present. The parapodia Uniramous. The notopodium Represented by long dorsal cirrus; cirrophore with at least four internal spines. The neuropodium Three pointed lobes; median lobe markedly larger than lateral lobes. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Cylindrical, slightly posteriorly tapered; 40 to 70 mm long; 4 to 6 mm broad. The prostomium Deeply posteriorly notched; four eyes, anterior pair larger and more widely spaced; two minute anterolateral antennae. The setae Falcigerous; blades of variable length; tips bidentate with two strong teeth and a fine straight accessory tooth. The cirri Dorsal cirri long, articulated; ventral cirri short, indistinctly jointed; two long anal cirri. The parapodia Well developed; setigerous lobe stout. The notopodium Dorsal cirri long, closely jointed; borne on long cirrophores with fine internal acicula. The neuropodium With presetal and postsetal lips; superior conical papilla present. The tentacular cirri Jointed, subequal; arranged in oblique rows 3,3,2. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Stout; 40 to 60 mm long; 16 to 17 rounded setigers. The prostomium Bilobed; antennae slender; palps stout; large ovoid facial tubercle anterior to prostomium. The setae Notosetae capillary, distally serrated; neurosetae falcigerous, blades bidentate with an additional fine accessory tooth. The cirri Dorsal and tentacular cirri elongate, annulated. The parapodia Well developed. The notopodium Notopodial capillaries from setiger 4 to 5; capillaries distally finely serrated. The neuropodium Bearing falcigerous neurosetae. The tentacular cirri Long, closely annulated; tentaculophores strengthened by black acicula. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Soft, dorsally swollen; ~12 mm long. The prostomium Broader than long; large eyes (possibly two pairs fused); palps bent ventrally; occipital flap present. The setae Compound; shaft-heads expanded; blades short, hooked; unidentate or with minute secondary tooth. The cirri Dorsal cirri long, indistinctly jointed. The parapodia Weakly developed. The notopodium Without distinct notosetae. The neuropodium Bearing compound setae. The tentacular cirri Long, indistinctly jointed. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body ~9 mm long; ~88 segments; pale in alcohol. The prostomium Four eyes; antennae short, subequal; palps broad, not fused. The setae Simple; shaft-head expanded; terminally trifalcate with three subequal claw-like teeth. The cirri Dorsal cirri very short, tapered, often coiled; 9 to 12 articulations; ventral cirri small. The parapodia Small; each parapodium with 3 to 6 simple setae. The notopodium Reduced; no distinct notosetae. The neuropodium Bearing simple setae only. The pharynx Elongate; proventriculus with ~40 rows of points. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender; ~35 mm long; two dark transverse cross-bars on anterior segments. The prostomium Four eyes; antennae stout, 8 to 12 articulations. The setae Anterior parapodia with compound bidentate setae; mid-body parapodia with 2 to 3 stout Y-shaped simple setae (derived from loss of blade of compound setae); compound setae reappearing posteriorly. The cirri Dorsal cirri stout; anterior cirri cylindrical with ~16 joints; median cirri shorter, fusiform with 8 to 12 joints. The parapodia Typical syllid form. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound and simple setae. The pharynx Long; single anterior tooth. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender; 20 to 60 mm long. The prostomium Four eyes. The setae Compound setae numerous with short unidentate or minutely bidentate blades; one to three stout simple setae formed by loss of blade, shaft-head obliquely truncate; aciculum with small apical knob. The cirri Dorsal cirri stout but tapered; 15 to 25 articulations; length approximately equal to body width. The parapodia Typical syllid form. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound and simple setae. The pharynx Long; single anterior tooth. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender; 15 to 25 mm; ~120 segments. The prostomium Broader than long; eyes absent. The setae Anterior compound setae with blades of unequal length, tips minutely bidentate; middle parapodia with superior Langerhansia-type setae with very long slender blades and inferior setae with normal unidentate blades; acicula very stout with blunt tip. The cirri Dorsal cirri about equal to body width; ~30 joints; ventral cirri short, arising near distal end of setigerous lobes. The parapodia Typical syllid parapodia. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound and modified setae. The antennae Short, subequal; 25 to 30 joints. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Thread-like; ~10 mm; slender. The prostomium With four eyes and two ocular specks. The setae Anterior compound setae with blades of variable length, terminal tooth stronger than secondary; middle parapodia with 1 to 2 superior Langerhansia-type setae with greatly elongated blades, remaining setae with short blades and secondary tooth stronger than terminal; acicula stout with knobbed tips in middle parapodia. The cirri Dorsal cirri long, slender; 15 to 25 joints, joints distinct anteriorly, poorly marked posteriorly; ventral cirri slightly longer than setigerous lobes. The parapodia Typical syllid parapodia. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound and modified setae. The pharynx Long; anterior tooth present. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Thread-like; 10 to 15 mm. The prostomium With four eyes and two ocular specks. The setae One to three superior compound setae with very long blades; ~six compound setae with normal bidentate blades, secondary tooth slender. The cirri Dorsal cirri short; 10 to 18 joints; joints always clearly marked. The parapodia Typical syllid parapodia. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound setae. The pharynx Long; anterior tooth present. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body 10 to 20 mm; anterior segments with two dark transverse lines. The prostomium With four eyes; palps fairly long, separate. The setae ~10 compound setae; blades strongly bidentate; of normal length. The cirri Dorsal cirri alternately long and short; with ~22 and ~27 joints respectively. The parapodia Typical syllid parapodia. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound setae. The antennae Median antenna with ~27 joints; lateral antennae with ~16 joints. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~40 mm; tough; anterior segments with broken brown transverse bars. The prostomium With four eyes. The setae All compound; blades strongly bidentate; of normal length. The cirri Dorsal cirri longer than body width; with ~20 to 40 distinct joints. The parapodia Typical syllid parapodia. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound setae. The pharynx Long; reaching setiger 12; anterior dorsal tooth present. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Smooth, colourless; ~15 mm long. The prostomium With four large eyes; palps long, separated at base; occipital flap absent. The setae Anterior and posterior feet with compound unidentate setae; middle feet with two simple setae formed by fusion of short hooked blade to shaft. The cirri Dorsal cirri alternating in length; longer cirri ~30-jointed and about equal to body width, shorter cirri with fewer joints; ventral cirri sausage-shaped. The parapodia Typical syllid parapodia. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound and simple setae depending on segment. The pharynx With dorsal tooth positioned far posteriorly at ~setiger 10. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Smooth, soft, rather broad; up to ~10 mm; ~75 segments. The prostomium With occipital flap covering posterior eye pair and part of prostomium. The setae Compound; blades short, unidentate. The cirri Dorsal cirri slender; ~20 joints. The parapodia Typical syllid parapodia. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound setae. The pharynx Long, broad; small dorsal tooth at ~setiger 8. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate, ribbon-like; ~25 mm long, ~2 mm broad; two dark transverse lines on anterior segments. The prostomium Broader than long, faintly bilobed; four anterior eyes; palps short; antennae short with 10 to 12 joints. The setae ~10 compound setae per parapodium; blades short, unidentate, hooked. The cirri Dorsal cirri short, stout, often spindle-shaped; 8 to 12 joints; purplish when fresh. The parapodia Typical for genus. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound setae. The reproduction Possibly single sexual stolon. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Very short, flattened, oval; ~8 mm long, ~1.8 mm broad; ~120 segments; segments extremely short, ~20 times broader than long. The prostomium Inserted between anterior segments; four eyes in rectangular arrangement; palps ovoid; antennae three, short, with 6 to 8 joints. The setae Simple; falcate blade fused to shaft-head. The cirri Dorsal cirri short with 6 to 8 joints; ventral cirri inconspicuous. The parapodia Reduced. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing simple setae. The pharynx Long, S-shaped; trepan with ~10 teeth. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate, flattened, ribbon-like; ~30 to 60 mm long; two purple transverse bars per segment; dorsal cirri often purple. The prostomium Broader than long; four eyes. The setae Compound, bidentate; secondary tooth close behind terminal tooth; blade without basal spur; cutting edge spinulose. The cirri Dorsal cirri alternating long and short; ~20 to 50 short joints; ventral cirri pointed. The parapodia Biramous, well developed. The notopodium With dorsal cirrus. The neuropodium Bearing compound setae. The reproduction Single stolon; clusters of buds absent. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Short; ~10 to 15 mm; 13 setigers; segments nearly as long as broad; dorsal pattern of broken purple bars. The prostomium Roughly square; four large eyes; palps bent ventrally, fused basally; prominent nuchal epaulettes reaching setiger 2. The setae Compound; blades finely bidentate; blade length variable. The cirri Dorsal cirri very long, coiled, pseudo-articulate; ventral cirri pinniform, postero-ventral, longer than setigerous lobes. The parapodia Well developed. The notopodium With long, coiled dorsal cirrus. The neuropodium With ventral cirrus and compound setae. The tentacular cirri Very long, coiled, pseudo-articulate. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small; ~5 mm; 37 to 46 segments; parapodia and cirri elongate. The prostomium Broader than long; palps large, fused basally, bent ventrally. The setae Compound setae with long, minutely bidentate blades; one superior simple sabre-like seta per parapodium with minutely serrated blade. The cirri Anterior dorsal cirri slightly swollen distally; posterior dorsal cirri long with 10 to 15 distinct joints; ventral cirri slender. The parapodia Long. The notopodium With compound setae and a simple superior seta. The neuropodium With compound setae. The tentacular cirri Distally swollen, wrinkled. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Soft, dorsally swollen, fragile; up to ~50 mm long by ~2 mm wide. The prostomium With four large eyes arranged rectangularly; median antenna inserted between and posterior to lateral antennae; large occipital flap covering most of prostomium. The setae ~25 compound setae per parapodium; blades short, triangular, bidentate; secondary tooth median on blade. The cirri Dorsal cirri tapered, smooth or faintly wrinkled; anterior dorsal cirri relatively long, middle-body dorsal cirri less than half body width; ventral cirri swollen, cushion-like, ventro-lateral to setigerous lobe. The parapodia With numerous compound setae. The notopodium Reduced; dorsal cirrus only. The neuropodium Setigerous lobe with compound setae. The antennae Tapered, smooth to faintly wrinkled. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small; ~4 mm long; ~45 segments. The prostomium Broader than long; two pairs of eyes; palps united basally, bent ventrally. The setae Compound only; blades short, unidentate, strongly hooked; simple setae absent. The cirri Dorsal cirri similar to antennae, equal to body width; ventral cirri conical. The parapodia Setigerous lobes truncate. The notopodium Reduced; dorsal cirrus only. The neuropodium Bearing compound setae. The antennae Tapered, wrinkled, non-annulated. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small; ~8 mm; soft, very fragile. The prostomium Not specified. The setae Compound only; very long, fine; blades slender, bidentate; terminal tooth strong and hooked; secondary tooth weak, directed toward terminal tooth; simple setae absent. The cirri Anterior dorsal cirri exceedingly long; posterior dorsal cirri shorter but still >2 times body width; ventral cirri large, triangular. The parapodia Setigerous lobes long. The notopodium With very long dorsal cirri only. The neuropodium Bearing compound setae only. The antennae Smooth, extremely long. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body ~12 mm; ~60 segments. The prostomium Broader than long; single median antenna arising near anterior margin; palps large, tapered, transversely striated, fused throughout. The setae Superior simple seta from ~setiger 12 onward; 1 to 3 compound setae with long, knife-like blades; 5 to 8 compound falcigers with short blades, secondary tooth large, terminal tooth minute. The cirri Dorsal cirri ovoid, present on all setigers; ventral cirri present throughout. The parapodia Setigerous lobes obliquely truncate. The notopodium With dorsal cirrus only. The neuropodium Bearing compound and simple setae. The pharynx Extending to setiger 6. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Minute, thread-like; ~5 mm; ~30 segments; tapered at both ends; segments ~4 times broader than long. The prostomium Broader than long; eyes absent; three minute papilliform antennae; palps very large, tapered, fused for half their length, projecting anteriorly as a rostrum. The setae All compound; long and fine; blades uniformly slender with blunt apical tooth. The cirri Dorsal cirri long, often coiled; ventral cirri slender, distinct. The parapodia Large; setigerous lobe with tapered, retractile dorsal projection. The notopodium Represented by long, often coiled dorsal cirrus. The neuropodium With setigerous lobe and ventral cirrus. The pharynx Short, broad, straight; to setiger 3; unarmed; dorsal tooth absent. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender; ~4.5 mm; 40 to 50 segments. The prostomium Broader than long; four eyes; lateral antennae short; median antenna long, club-shaped, arising between eyes; palps large, fused almost to tips. The setae Superior simple seta with obliquely truncate tip from ~setiger 10, increasing in stoutness posteriorly; inferior simple seta appearing in posterior segments; anterior feet with two superior compound setae with long sword-shaped blades, reduced to one then absent posteriorly; ~3 compound setae with short bidentate chopper-shaped blades, terminal tooth minute, secondary tooth larger. The cirri Dorsal cirri ovoid, present on all segments including setiger 2; ventral cirri slightly smaller, present on all feet. The parapodia Setigerous lobes truncate; parapodia with single aciculum bearing knobbed tip. The notopodium Reduced; no true notosetae. The neuropodium Setigerous lobe bearing compound and simple setae. The pharynx ~3 segments long; anterior dorsal tooth present. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender, smooth, pale; ~5 mm long; segment number not fixed. The prostomium Short; 2 to 3 pairs of eyes; median antenna longer than prostomium, reaching palpal base; lateral antennae short, ~â median length. The setae Compound setae uniform with straight unidentate blades and pointed shaft-heads; superior simple seta blunt, needle-like from ~setiger 10, stouter posteriorly; inferior simple seta present on last few segments. The cirri Dorsal cirri small, ovoid, absent from setiger 2; ventral cirri longer than setigerous lobes, projecting distally. The parapodia Small; setigerous lobes low. The notopodium Absent as a distinct lobe. The neuropodium Bears compound and simple setae. The pharynx To setiger 5; dorsal tooth present. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Minute, smooth; ~2 mm long; segments numerous. The prostomium Broader than long; two pairs of eyes; anterior eye-specks sometimes present; median antenna equal to prostomial length; lateral antennae shorter. The setae Three types first superior simple seta with obliquely truncate tip; then superior compound seta with swollen shaft-head and short triangular blade; third  ~3 compound setae with short bidentate blades, secondary tooth larger than apical. The cirri Dorsal cirri ovoid, absent from setiger 2; ventral cirri present. The parapodia Small; setigerous lobes low. The notopodium Absent as distinct lobe. The neuropodium Bears simple and compound setae. The peristomium tentacular segment Distinct. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Short, ~3 mm; ~29 setigers; surface lightly papillose. The prostomium Broader than long; two pairs of coalescent eyes; three long piriform antennae on anterior margin. The setae Superior simple setae with curved tips; compound setae with unidentate blades; inferior simple seta present in posterior segments. The cirri Dorsal cirri piriform; absent from setiger 2; ventral cirri digitiform. The parapodia Setigerous lobe conical; two apical papillae. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Setigerous lobe bearing simple and compound setae. The pharynx With anterior tooth; extending to setiger 2; surrounded by brownish glands. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender; 15 to 25 mm; ~120 segments. The prostomium Broader than long; eyes absent. The setae Anterior compound setae with blades of unequal length, tips minutely bidentate; middle parapodia with superior Langerhansia-type setae with very long slender blades and inferior setae with normal unidentate blades; acicula very stout with blunt tip. The cirri Dorsal cirri about equal to body width; ~30 joints; ventral cirri short, arising near distal end of setigerous lobes. The parapodia Typical syllid parapodia. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Bearing compound and modified setae. The antennae Short, subequal; 25 to 30 joints. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Short, ~3 mm; ~30 segments; flattened; surface densely covered with adhesive papillae extending onto palps and parapodia. The prostomium Broader than long; three pairs of eyes; three equal flask-shaped antennae, median antenna inserted posterior to laterals. The setae About five compound setae per foot with unidentate blades; superior simple seta with oblique tip from setiger 6 to 8 onward. The cirri Tentacular and dorsal cirri flask-shaped, slightly larger than antennae; dorsal cirri absent from setiger 2; ventral cirri small, cylindrical. The parapodia Small; without dorsal glands. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Setigerous lobe bearing compound and simple setae. The pharynx With anterior dorsal tooth; extending to setiger 3. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Relatively large; up to ~10 mm; ~36 setigers; dorsum smooth; adhesive papillae absent. The prostomium Arched anteriorly; two pairs of eyes; anterior eye-specks present; antennae flask-shaped, about prostomial length. The setae Compound setae with unidentate blades of variable length; superior simple seta present. The cirri Dorsal cirri flask-shaped anteriorly, more elongate posteriorly; dorsal cirri absent from setiger 2; ventral cirri small, conical. The parapodia Small; setigerous lobes present. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Setigerous lobe bearing compound and simple setae. The peristomium tentacular segment Short; embracing prostomium; tentacular cirri lateral, smaller than antennae. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Very long, smooth, slender; ~35 mm  times 0.5 mm; >200 segments; anterior segments short and crowded, posterior segments elongate. The prostomium Bluntly conical; four eyes; three ovoid frontal antennae, median antenna superior to laterals. The setae Anterior parapodia with compound setae bearing short triangular bidentate blades; posterior parapodia with simple setae, shafts short, tips bluntly triangular. The cirri Dorsal cirri ovoid, compressed, subequal to setigerous lobe; present on all setigers including setiger 2; ventral cirri absent. The parapodia Conical setigerous lobes; ventral cirri absent, fused to posterior margin of setigerous lobe. The notopodium Reduced. The neuropodium Setigerous lobe bearing compound or simple setae. The pharynx Slender; reaching setiger 6; unarmed; trepan absent. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body 10 to 25 mm; paired dorsal red pigment rectangles (fading in alcohol). The prostomium Small; three long antennae; median antenna longer than laterals; palps not visible dorsally. The setae Compound; bidentate blades; shaft-heads denticulate. The cirri Tentacular cirri and dorsal cirri of setiger 1 very long; subsequent dorsal cirri shorter than body width. The parapodia Normal autolytine type. The pharynx S-shaped; trepan with ~20 teeth, alternating large and small. The peristomium tentacular segment Tentacular cirri very long. The proventriculus With 50 to 60 rows of points. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body 6 to 12 mm; dusky anteriorly, otherwise pale. The prostomium Rounded; four eyes; three long, wrinkled antennae; palps slightly visible dorsally. The setae Four to five compound bidentate setae; posterior feet with single superior simple seta, pointed. The cirri Dorsal cirri of setiger 1 long; subsequent dorsal cirri very short, ~Â¼ body width. The parapodia Typical autolytine type. The pharynx Long, twisted; margin weakly chitinised; enclosed in sheath with ~10 papillae; numerous minute indistinct teeth. The peristomium tentacular segment Dorsal tentacular cirri long, antenna-like; ventral tentacular cirri much shorter. The proventriculus At setiger 4; 25 to 30 rows of points. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small; ~6 mm; 30 to 40 segments; colourless. The prostomium Broad, subquadrate; eyes indistinct or absent; antennae paired, widely separated; palpophores stout, fully fused to prostomium; palpostyles slender, longer than antennae. The setae All homogomph spinigers; inferior neuropodial setae with shorter blades, shaft-heads tending to hemigomph condition. The cirri Dorsal cirri short; ventral cirri small. The parapodia First two setigers uniramous; notopodial lobes and notosetae absent, dorsal cirrus retained; subsequent parapodia biramous, uniform throughout. The notopodium Superior lobe absent; inferior lobe elongated, exceeding dorsal cirrus; intermediate setigerous lobe absent. The neuropodium Stout conical setigerous lobe; very small inferior lobe; ventral cirrus small. The proboscis Without paragnaths; jaws paired, large, with seven teeth each. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Elongate; ~60 mm; ~120 segments. The prostomium Oval; single slender median antenna; palps paired, long. The setae Anterior setae heterogomph and homogomph spinigers, heterogomph falcigers with long blades; posterior notosetae homogomph spinigers and hemigomph falcigers with bidentate apices; posterior neurosetae homogomph and heterogomph spinigers and heterogomph falcigers. The cirri Dorsal cirri very long anteriorly; ventral cirri reduced posteriorly. The parapodia Anterior and posterior parapodia dissimilar. The notopodium Anterior parapodia with two notopodial lobes and very long dorsal cirrus; posterior parapodia with superior notopodial lobe forming cirrophore of dorsal cirrus. The neuropodium Anterior neuropodium with setigerous lobe bearing long presetal lip; posterior neuropodium with inferior lobe reduced to ventral papilla on setigerous lobe. The proboscis Paragnath formula I=0, II=12, III=5, IV=12, V=0, VI broad fleshy lobe, VII to VIII=0. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender; up to ~85 mm; colour pale, gills red in life. The prostomium Deeply cleft between antennae; palps short, fused to divided prostomium. The setae Homogomph spinigers only; neuropodial blades shorter than notopodial. The cirri Dorsal cirri tapered anteriorly; ventral cirri short. The parapodia Anterior, branchiferous, and posterior parapodia differentiated. The notopodium Anterior feet with three lobes; branchiferous feet with three-lobed notopodium; posterior feet simplified, bilabiate. The neuropodium Anterior feet with four postsetal lobes, later with one to two presetal lobes; branchiferous feet with setigerous lobe subdivided into six, later four lobes; posterior neuropodium conical, bilabiate. The branchiae Bipinnate branchial filaments on dorsal cirri from ~setiger 12 to 24. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to ~50 mm; anterior segments with brown spotting. The prostomium As broad as long; median longitudinal groove. The setae Notosetae homogomph spinigers throughout; neuropodial falcigers with long straight blades anteriorly, shorter posteriorly with terminal tendon; posterior neuropodia with 1 to 3 enlarged simple hammer-shaped setae formed by blade fusion. The cirri Dorsal cirri elongated posteriorly; ventral cirri present. The parapodia Anterior and posterior parapodia differentiated. The notopodium Three lobes throughout; intermediate lobe well developed anteriorly, reduced posteriorly; dorsal cirrus slightly longer anteriorly, long posteriorly. The neuropodium Setigerous lobe with long postsetal lip; posterior neuropodia with modified simple setae. The proboscis Maxillary ring smooth; area VI with large soft transverse lobe; areas VII to VIII with row of six soft papillae. Identify the polychaete species.

The parapodia Body divided into anterior uniramous and posterior biramous regions; Anterior region, 28 to 30 uniramous segments; parapodium with a strap-like dorsal cirrus, a single tapered setigerous lobe formed by fusion of pre- and postsetal lobes, and a ventral cirrus similar to the dorsal one; base of dorsal cirrus expanded inferiorly from about setiger 20 onwards; Posterior region, Biramous parapodia; notopodium with flattened dorsal cirrus and a setigerous lobe bearing a distinct apical notch; neuropodium similar in form to the anterior setigerous lobe. The proboscis With five longitudinal bands of papillae; a pair of macrognaths each with five teeth; dorsal arc of 15 to 25 micrognaths. The distribution to southern Africa. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body About 25 mm long. The prostomium Anterior margin distinctly notched; a median keel present, extending posteriorly to setiger 2; four eyes present. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large for the genus, up to 25 mm long with about 80 segments.. The prostomium Anterior margin distinctly notched; outlined in black; with a median keel extending posteriorly to setiger 2; eye-spots variable, ranging from none to about ten.. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small, about 10 mm long, approximately 70 segments.. The prostomium Bilobed; posterior keel extending to setiger 2; two eye-spots.. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to 20 mm long; about 100 segments; boring habit in living gastropod shells.. The prostomium Anterior margin not notched; posterior keel extending to setiger 3; buccal segment forming paired supporting lobes laterally.. The cirri Notosetae present on setiger 1.. The pygidium Small.. The branchiae Present from setiger 7 to setiger 37.. The antennae and tentacular cirri Not differentiated in available material.. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Small; about 5 mm long; 24 to 45 segments.. The prostomium Anterior margin bilobed; posterior dorsal ridge extending to setiger 2; eyes absent.. The setae Setiger 5 with two to three enlarged bluntly hooked setae with stout hoods; neuropodial bidentate hooded hooks from setiger 7 onward, three to four in number; posterior notosetae eight to twelve stout spines, forming a cone when retracted and a funnel when everted.. The cirri Notosetae present on setiger 1, two to three in number.. The branchiae Present from setiger 7 to setiger 14.. The antennae and tentacular cirri Not differentiated.. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Large; up to 45 mm long; about 150 segments.. The prostomium Anterior margin notched; posterior ridge extending to setiger 2; eyes absent.. The setae Setiger 5 with enlarged hooks having curved, blunt tips flattened on concave side, accompanied by fine straight spear-shaped capillaries; neuropodial bidentate hooded hooks from setiger 7 onward, three to four per parapodium; posterior notopodia with packets of very fine needle-like setae embedded near bases of capillaries.. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to 40 mm long; about 130 segments.. The prostomium Anterior margin deeply notched; dorsal ridge extending posteriorly to setiger 2; eyes four or absent.. The setae Setiger 5 with two specialised series a row of fine hastate setae and an oblique row of stout hooks excavated on the concave side; bidentate hooded neuropodial hooks from setiger 7 onward; posterior notopodia with three to four stout straight spines plus capillaries.. The cirri Few notosetae on setiger 1.. The pygidium Saucer-shaped with a dorsal notch.. The branchiae From setigers 7 to 9; extending beyond mid-body.. The antennae and tentacular cirri Not differentiated.. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to 30 mm long; about 100 segments; anterior and posterior ends often blackened.. The prostomium Slightly notched anteriorly; dorsal ridge extending posteriorly to setiger 2; four eyes in juveniles, eyes often absent in adults.. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to 30 mm long; about 100 segments.. The prostomium Anterior margin deeply notched; dorsal ridge extending posteriorly; single free occipital tentacle; two to four eyes.. The setae Setiger 5 with enlarged spoon-shaped hooks arranged in a horseshoe; bidentate hooded hooks in neuropodium from setiger 8 onward; no specialised notosetae in posterior segments.. The antennae and tentacular cirri Occipital tentacle present; other structures not differentiated.. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to 20 mm long; about 130 segments; tubes in old gastropod shells occupied by hermit crabs; palps with black bars, remainder unpigmented.. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body About 12 mm long.. The prostomium Anterior margin faintly notched; single posterior occipital tentacle; four eyes.. The setae Setiger 5 with normal notopodial capillaries plus two specialised rows anterior row of recurved fang-like setae with basal swelling of blade, posterior row of stout, simple, faintly curved hooks; normal neuropodial setae on setiger 5; bidentate hooded hooks in neuropodia from setiger 8 onward; no specialised posterior notosetae.. If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to 60 mm long; about 180 segments.. The prostomium Broad, anterior margin straight; large pointed lateral peaks; single posterior occipital tentacle; four eyes; paired interrupted dorsal sensory grooves extending to setiger 4.. The setae Notosetae of first setiger very long; enlarged neuropodial setae of setiger 1 with recurved blades; from setiger 15 onward neuropodia with bidentate hooks bearing partial guard below rostrum, plus an inferior sabre-like seta.. The antennae and tentacular cirri Occipital tentacle single, posterior.. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Slender; up to 25 mm long; about 60 segments.. The prostomium Transversely oval anteriorly; laterally supported by buccal segment; posteriorly narrowed; single occipital tentacle; two pairs of subdermal eyes; paired raised nuchal ridges extending to setiger 4.. The setae Notosetae winged capillaries throughout; first setiger with very long capillaries, markedly shorter from setiger 4 onward; neuropodium of setiger 1 with stout, strongly curved seta; tridentate hooks with partial or absent guard from setiger 15 onward; sabre-like genital setae without fibrils from about setiger 15, occasionally present anteriorly.. The parapodia Notopodial postsetal lobes of setigers 1 to 4 pointed; setigers 5 to 12 blunt and broadened; subsequent notopodia again slender and pointed; transverse dorsal ridges on setigers 16 to 35; neuropodial postsetal lamellae pointed on first four setigers, low and rounded thereafter.. The antennae and tentacular cirri Occipital tentacle single, posterior.. Identify the polychaete species.

If the diagnostic characters are as follows The body Up to 60 mm long; 1 to 1.5 mm broad.. The prostomium Broad, shield-shaped; laterally projecting frontal peaks; posterior end of cephalic keel free; numerous eye-specks.. The setae Notopodial capillaries undotted; anterior neuropodia with five to six large capillaries with abruptly pointed tips; long bidentate hooded hooks from about setigers 40 to 70; sabre-like setae in posterior neuropodia.. The parapodia Neuropodial lamellae rounded anteriorly; posterior lamellae with nipple-like projection..
